content: fiberista yarn cozy by ariane gallizzi stitch npaste designs materials 2 x 25g of worsted weight yarn main and contrast color sample on the left is cascade 220 superwash or 2 x 25g of fingering weight yarn main and contrast color sample on the right is anzula squishy us 6 4 0 mm and us 8 5 0 mm circular needle 40 /100 cm for magic loop or a set of dpns darning needle notes this yarn cozy is the perfect project for a first-time brioche knitter who wants to try two-color brioche knitting in the round it is also a great way to use leftover yarn since it uses very little yarn dig into your stash and find some nice contrasting colored yarns the pattern contains instructions for the bowl knitted in worsted weight yarn as well as in fingering weight yarn held double the cozy is knit top down note brioche stitch creates a rather loose and lofty fabric which is why it is recommended to go down a needle size or two from what the yarn suggests start knitting with a us 6 4 0 mm needle and see how that works for you sizes & finished measurements diameter 4 in 10 cm height 4 in 10 cm abbreviations & stitches used k = knit p = purl brk = brioche knit k2tog = knit 2 together brp = brioche purl sl1yo = slip 1 with yarn over mc = main color cc = contrast color gauge 16 sts = 4 10cm in brioche stitch fiberista yarn cozy by sitch npaste designs special stitches brioche knit brk knit the stitch that was slipped in the row before together with its yarn over brioche purl brp purl the stitch that was slipped in the row before together with its yarn over sl1yo bring yarn to front sl1 purlwise and work a yarn over pattern instructions with smaller needle and mc using long tail cast on loosely co 56 sts in worsted weight yarn 48 sts in fingering weight yarn held double join to knit in the round round 1 k1 sl1yo repeat to end let mc hang to back round 2 with cc sl1yo brp repeat to end let cc hang to back round 3 with mc brk sl1yo repeat to end let mc hang to back repeat rounds 2&3 twenty-three more times switch to bigger needle and hold mc and cc together next round p1 brp repeat to end work decreases for bottom as follows still holding mc and cc together for
